summary: An email from Lee Plourde to NYM/Executive Staff at the Bureau of Prisons forwarding a psychological reconstruction document for Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054). The email includes attachments with the document content and metadata showing it was later archived and tagged. This is an interim Bureau of Prisons psychological reconstruction report on the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Complex (MCC) in New York. The report details Epstein's background, institutional history, mental health assessments, and the circumstances leading to his death, concluding it was a suicide. It also outlines numerous operational failures and procedural violations within the MCC and provides recommendations for improvement. This document is a collection of email correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) system, primarily involving BOP staff and journalists. It includes internal and external communications regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein, media inquiries about his incarceration and death, a timeline of his arrival at MCC New York, a news clip summary, and a request from a defense attorney for a private investigator visit. This document is a collection of email correspondence and attachments from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) system, primarily concerning administrative matters related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at MCC New York. It includes a sponsoring attorney form for a private investigator, internal BOP emails about news articles and Epstein's status, and a specific email thread regarding the discontinuation of his suicide watch and psychological observation. This document contains email chains from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding the psychological observation and conditions of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July 2019, just before his death. It includes updates on his mental state, complaints about his cell conditions, and a later email regarding a draft statement about staff reassignments following his suicide. This is an interim Bureau of Prisons psychological reconstruction report on the death by suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Complex (MCC) in New York. The report details Epstein's background, institutional history, mental health assessments, antecedent circumstances, and concludes with numerous operational recommendations based on identified failures in procedures, documentation, and staff training. This document is a collection of email correspondence from August-September 2019, primarily concerning the Bureau of Prisons' response to follow-up inquiries from the United Kingdom regarding the extradition case of Jabir Motiwala, which was impacted by the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, staffing issues, and the investigation into Epstein's death. This document contains email correspondence from August 2019 between Bureau of Prisons (BOP) officials discussing draft press release language regarding placing staff on administrative leave following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It includes a forwarded Google Alert email about the Bureau of Prisons from September 2019. This document contains email correspondence from August 2019 regarding the Bureau of Prisons' response to Jeffrey Epstein's death, including draft press release language about placing staff on administrative leave and reassigning the warden. It also includes a Google Alert email from November 2019 and a July 2019 email about Epstein's status on suicide watch. This document contains internal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) email correspondence regarding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It includes a follow-up email identifying Epstein and his cellmate, a timeline of his arrival and housing, and a reference to a reconstruction report following his death. This is an interim psychological reconstruction report by the Bureau of Prisons regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Complex (MCC) in New York. The report details Epstein's background, institutional history, mental health assessments, antecedent circumstances, and concludes with operational recommendations, highlighting numerous procedural failures and inconsistencies in his supervision and care. This document is a collection of email correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) concerning the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death. It includes a Google Alerts digest on federal prison news, internal BOP emails about staff reassignments and investigations, and discussions about missing video evidence and responding to extradition inquiries from the UK. The emails reveal internal coordination regarding the suicide investigation, missing evidence, and public relations responses. This document is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York forwarding a series of questions from the UK regarding conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The questions cite a report by an unnamed former warden (Ms. [redacted]) and news articles, focusing on staffing, overcrowding, sanitation, and psychiatric care deficiencies at the facility. A report detailing the suicide of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and the subsequent investigations ordered by Attorney General William Barr. The document extensively describes the poor conditions, understaffing, and procedural failures at MCC, citing numerous sources including journalists, attorneys, former inmates, and current staff. This document contains a BBC news article from August 12, 2019, detailing the poor conditions and staffing shortages at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It also includes internal Bureau of Prisons emails from September 2019 discussing procedures for suicide watch and responses to UK extradition inquiries. The article highlights systemic failures in the prison system, while the emails reveal internal protocols for inmate psychological care. This document is an email chain from September 2019 within the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding follow-up requests from UK attorneys handling the extradition of defendant Jabir Motiwala. The UK attorneys, prompted by a report from a former MCC warden following Jeffrey Epstein's death, seek information about conditions and procedures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), including staffing, suicide watch protocols, and sanitation. BOP staff coordinate to formulate a response, noting they cannot comment on the ongoing Epstein investigation. This document is an email chain from September 2019 within the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) discussing how to respond to follow-up requests from the United Kingdom regarding conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, in light of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The requests are part of an extradition case for defendant Jabir Motiwala. The emails contain a detailed list of questions about staffing, procedures, and conditions at the MCC, referencing a report by a former warden and news articles. This document is an email chain from September 2019 within the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) and the U.S. Attorney's Office, discussing how to respond to follow-up questions from UK authorities regarding the extradition of defendant Jabir Motiwala. The questions focus on conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in the wake of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including staffing, suicide watch protocols, sanitation, and allegations of misconduct. This document is a collection of email correspondence and metadata from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) system, primarily concerning inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054). It includes internal emails about his psychological observation status, attorney visits, and a forwarded Google Alert about the BOP. The emails reveal details about Epstein's conditions and schedule in the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York prior to his death. This document contains email correspondence from late 2019 related to the Federal Bureau of Prisons, including a Google Alert summary, a complaint about medical neglect at MCC New York referencing Epstein's suicide, and an internal BOP report about an attempted suicide by an inmate who referenced Epstein. It highlights ongoing issues within BOP facilities following Epstein's death. This document contains email correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) in late 2019, discussing a medical emergency at MCC New York, media inquiries about conditions post-Epstein, and internal budget discussions regarding TDY costs related to the Epstein incident. It reveals ongoing operational and reputational challenges for the BOP following Jeffrey Epstein's death. This document is a series of email exchanges from August 2019 between defense attorney Bruce Barket, federal prosecutors, and Bureau of Prisons staff regarding arranging a visit for inmate Nicholas Tartaglione with his parents at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The emails discuss scheduling a meeting to negotiate conditions for Tartaglione withdrawing a request to be moved from MCC, citing a 'crucial stage' in his capital case. This document contains email correspondence from August-December 2019 regarding legal visits for Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York and a media inquiry about conditions at MCC following Epstein's death. It includes communications between Epstein's attorney Bruce Barket and Bureau of Prisons staff, as well as internal BOP discussions about responding to a New York Daily News reporter. This document contains internal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) email correspondence from 2019. It includes a forwarded media inquiry about a paramedic possibly leaking details of Jeffrey Epstein's death online, internal news digests about BOP issues (including the Epstein suicide blame game), and an email chain discussing the missing video footage from Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt in July 2019. The emails reveal internal BOP communications regarding the fallout from Epstein's death and related investigations. This document contains internal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) email correspondence from July-October 2019 regarding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death. It includes discussions about media inquiries, facility placement for another inmate, and a suicide watch/psych observation update listing Epstein. The emails reveal BOP's internal communication and containment efforts following Epstein's incident. This document consists of two email updates from a forensic psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the suicide watch and psychological observation status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein (BOP #76318-054) on July 24, 2019. The emails were sent to a large distribution list of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) staff. This document contains email correspondence from December 2019 regarding efforts by Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorneys to arrange for a private investigator to visit him at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It also includes a separate email chain from August 2019 expressing concerns about staffing issues at MCC Chicago following Epstein's death. This document contains email correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) system, primarily concerning inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Register Number 76318-054). It includes internal emails about his medical records, public inmate locator information, and an autopsy case number request following his death. It also includes a Google Alert email about news coverage of Epstein's suicide and its impact on the BOP. This document contains a series of internal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) emails from August-November 2019 concerning the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The emails discuss obtaining the autopsy case number and report, administrative leave for staff, suicide watch procedures, and the temporary reassignment of the MCC warden. This document contains email correspondence from August 2019 regarding the drafting of a statement about actions taken by the Bureau of Prisons following Jeffrey Epstein's apparent suicide. It includes internal edits to the statement, a Google Alert email about the Bureau of Prisons, and a separate email request from an attorney seeking statements from inmate Nicholas Tartaglione regarding Epstein's attempted suicide. This document contains email correspondence from attorney Bruce Barket to Bureau of Prisons officials requesting records of statements made by Nicholas Tartaglione regarding Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt in July 2019. It also includes internal BOP emails discussing draft press language about placing staff on leave after Epstein's death and a Google Alert email. This document consists of forwarded Google Alert emails sent to a Bureau of Prisons email address (rormond@bop.gov) in July and August 2019. The alerts contain news summaries on various prison-related topics, including multiple mentions of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and a report about a mural in his mansion. The emails were later archived and tagged as responsive in the Epstein case. This document is a collection of email correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) system, primarily concerning a medical emergency complaint about an inmate at MCC New York and containing forwarded Google Alerts about prison news. The key email chain involves a complaint from Rabbi Shmuel Spritzer about the medical neglect of inmate Michael Elansky, drawing a direct comparison to the facility where Jeffrey Epstein died. Other emails include Google Alerts about prison riots and Epstein's jail conditions, and a separate email forwarding a document about Epstein. This document contains internal Bureau of Prisons emails and attachments detailing the timeline of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including the suicide watch log mix-up and subsequent internal review. It includes a minute-by-minute account of August 9-10, 2019, and correspondence about preparing an official response. This is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York to the Assistant Director of Reentry Services, responding to a psychological reconstruction report on inmate Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details institutional responses to 13 recommendations regarding suicide prevention, cellmate assignments, documentation accuracy, and operational procedures, while defending staff decisions and outlining corrective actions. This document is an email from Lee Plourde at the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) forwarding a psychological reconstruction report for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (BOP #76318-054) to several BOP staff members, including Associate Warden Charisma Edge, on October 4, 2019. It is a routine administrative communication regarding inmate records. This is an interim psychological reconstruction report on the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Complex (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. The report details Epstein's background, institutional history, mental health assessments, antecedent circumstances, and concludes his death was a suicide. It identifies numerous operational failures, inconsistencies in documentation, and procedural violations, and provides recommendations for improvement. This document is an email chain from September 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office and BOP officials regarding follow-up inquiries from the United Kingdom about conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The UK requests information for an extradition case (Jabir Motiwala) and asks specific questions about staffing, protocols, and conditions related to Epstein's suicide. This document is an email chain from September 2019 between U.S. Department of Justice officials and Bureau of Prisons staff. It concerns follow-up requests from the United Kingdom regarding prison conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, specifically in the context of Jeffrey Epstein's death and its impact on an extradition case for defendant Jabir Motiwala. The emails contain detailed questions about staffing, suicide watch protocols, and facility conditions, along with initial responses from BOP personnel. This document is an email chain between U.S. and UK legal officials discussing follow-up requests from the UK regarding conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, in the context of the extradition case of Jabir Motiwala and following the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It contains a list of detailed questions about prison staffing, suicide watch protocols, sanitation, and oversight failures related to Epstein's death, along with a partial response from the Bureau of Prisons. This document is an email chain from September 2019 between U.S. Department of Justice and Bureau of Prisons officials, discussing follow-up requests from the United Kingdom regarding prison conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The inquiries focus on staffing, suicide watch protocols, cellmate policies, and overall facility conditions in the context of a UK extradition case for defendant Jabir Motiwala. This document is an email from Assistant United States Attorney Jonathan Rebold, dated September 17, 2019, containing a list of detailed questions from the United Kingdom regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The questions focus on alleged staff negligence, falsification of records, severe understaffing, overcrowding, and poor sanitation and mental health care conditions at the facility. This document is an email chain from September 2019 between U.S. Department of Justice officials and a Bureau of Prisons attorney, responding to follow-up requests from the United Kingdom regarding conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The inquiries stem from a UK extradition case for defendant Jabir Motiwala, who cited a report on alleged deficiencies at the MCC. The responses detail BOP psychological protocols, staffing, and general conditions while avoiding direct comment on the Epstein incident due to ongoing investigations. This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and Bureau of Prisons staff regarding follow-up questions from the United Kingdom about conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The questions focus on staffing, suicide watch protocols, sanitation, and other operational issues, with some responses provided by BOP. This document is an email chain from September 2019 between U.S. Department of Justice attorneys and Bureau of Prisons staff regarding follow-up requests from the United Kingdom concerning the extradition of defendant Jabir Motiwala. The UK's inquiries focus on conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death, including staffing, suicide watch protocols, sanitation, and psychological care. The chain includes a prior internal BOP email detailing psychological observation procedures and confirming Epstein's removal from suicide watch on July 10, 2019. This document contains email correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status on suicide watch and psychological observation in July 2019, and a later email from October 2019 distributing a psychological reconstruction report. It details Epstein's complaints about his cell conditions and health, and shows a wide distribution list of BOP staff. This document appears to be metadata from an email system, showing the creation and tagging of an email with an attachment titled 'Psych Reconst - Epstein #76318-054.docx'. It includes audit logs indicating the email was created in October 2019 and later tagged as responsive in May 2020. This is an interim psychological reconstruction report by the Bureau of Prisons regarding the death by suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Complex in New York. The report details Epstein's background, institutional history, mental health assessments, antecedent circumstances, and identifies numerous operational failures and procedural violations. It concludes with multiple recommendations for improving suicide prevention and inmate management. This is an email from Lee Plourde at the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding a psychological reassessment for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (BOP #76318-054), scheduled for October 4, 2019. The email was sent to multiple BOP staff members and includes an attachment titled 'Psych Recast - Epstein #76318-054.docx'. This is an interim psychological reconstruction report by the Bureau of Prisons regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Complex (MCC) in New York. The report details Epstein's background, institutional history, mental health assessments, and the circumstances leading to his death, concluding it was a suicide. It identifies numerous procedural failures and inconsistencies in documentation, observation, and housing assignments, and provides operational recommendations. This document is a collection of three Google Alert emails sent to a Bureau of Prisons email address (rormond@bop.gov) in late 2019. The alerts contain aggregated news headlines mentioning the 'bureau of prisons' and 'prison', including multiple references to Jeffrey Epstein's death in federal custody and other prison-related news. This document contains email correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) in August 2019. It includes a Google Alert summary about the BOP and Epstein's death, a request from the Florida Department of Law Enforcement for Epstein's death documentation, internal BOP emails discussing the timeline of Epstein's arrival and housing at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July 2019, and an email exchange between defense attorney Bruce Barket and a BOP staff attorney regarding a client meeting. This document is a collection of email correspondence primarily between defense attorney Bruce Barket and Bureau of Prisons staff regarding scheduling meetings and visits for his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019. A later email from December 2019 discusses the missing/corrupted video footage from outside the cell shared by Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein at the time of Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt in July 2019. This document is a series of email chains from December 2019 and August 2019 concerning the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death and related matters at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The emails discuss missing video surveillance from Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt in July 2019, administrative actions against MCC staff, and legal discussions regarding another inmate, Tartaglione. This document is a collection of email correspondence primarily concerning logistical arrangements for attorney visits and family visits for inmate Nicholas Tartaglione at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It also includes a brief, separate email chain regarding attorney access for Jeffrey Epstein following his arrest. The emails involve attorneys, a U.S. Attorney, and MCC staff coordinating schedules and visit approvals. This document contains email correspondence from July 2019 regarding attorney access to Jeffrey Epstein after his arrest, followed by several Google Alert emails from August-October 2019 sent to a Bureau of Prisons email address. The alerts contain news summaries about federal prison security, Epstein's death, and other BOP-related topics. This document contains email correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP), including forwarded court orders related to the USA v. Jeffrey Epstein case, internal discussions about placing staff on administrative leave following Epstein's death, and Google Alerts emails about federal prison news and Epstein's death. It reveals internal BOP communications regarding the investigation into Epstein's death and monitoring of related media coverage.

events.title: Psychological reconstruction document forwarded
events.description: Lee Plourde emails a psychological reconstruction document for Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) to NYM/Executive Staff at the Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Document tagged in archive
events.description: The email and attachment are tagged multiple times in the BOP archive system under identifier BOP01703.MXRADMI.MXRDOMI.

events.title: Florida Plea Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered a non-prosecution agreement and pleaded guilty to one count of Solicitation of Prostitution and one count of Procuring a Person Under the Age of 18 for Prostitution in Florida.

events.title: Federal Sex Trafficking Charges
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was formally charged with Sex Trafficking Conspiracy and Sex Trafficking in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Arrest at Teterboro
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey upon his return from Paris, France, and transported to MCC New York.

events.title: Bail Denied
events.description: Judge M. Berman denied Jeffrey Epstein's request for bail and pretrial release, remanding him to custody.

events.title: First Suicide Incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a piece of orange cloth around his neck, showing friction marks. He was placed on suicide watch. Motivation was never determined.

events.title: Court Documents Unsealed
events.description: Approximately 2,000 pages of court documents were unsealed, containing graphic allegations against Jeffrey Epstein and naming other high-profile figures.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his SHU cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. He was pronounced deceased at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m. The report concludes his death was a suicide.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. A press release is issued, and journalists ask follow-up questions about whether he hung himself, who found him, and his suicide watch status.

events.title: Epstein's arrival at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrives at MCC New York and is initially placed in general population before being moved to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for safety concerns.

events.title: Epstein placed in Psychological Observation
events.description: Upon return of Psychology Service staff, Epstein is moved to Psychology Observation for evaluation. Notes indicate suicide watch was not warranted, but he was under 24-hour observation.

events.title: Epstein returned to SHU with cell mate
events.description: Epstein is returned to the Special Housing Unit with a cell mate, where he remains until July 23.

events.title: AG Barr comments on Epstein's death
events.description: Attorney General William Barr states that Epstein's death was 'a perfect storm of screw-ups,' as reported in news clips circulated among BOP staff.

events.title: Email re: Defense Investigator Permission
events.description: Sarah Sacks sends an email regarding defense private investigator permission to visit, with attachments including a sponsoring attorney form.

events.title: Distribution of News Articles on Epstein Death
events.description: Susan Allison distributes internal BOP email with noteworthy news articles, including one revealing a psychologist approved Epstein's removal from suicide watch and another criticizing lack of prison suicide data.

events.title: Email on Epstein's Status
events.description: Charisma Edge, an Associate Warden, sends an email with subject 'Epstein, Reg. No. 76318-054' with an attached PDF (content largely garbled/scanned).

events.title: Suicide Watch/Psych Observation Update
events.description: Email thread discussing that inmate Jeffrey Epstein's suicide watch had been discontinued ('None') and he was on Psych Observation level 1. A follow-up email states he was assessed, seemed stable, but complained about conditions.

events.title: Psych Ops Discontinued
events.description: Noted in an email header that 'Psych Ops discontinued on 7/30/18 at 8:15 am' for Epstein (note: year discrepancy in text: 7/30/18).

events.title: Email Chain on Epstein's Condition
events.description: Email correspondence begins regarding inmate Epstein's psychological observation status and his complaints about cell conditions, including a running toilet and numbness.

events.title: Epstein's Complaints and Observation
events.description: Further emails detail Epstein's complaints about being in Attorney Conference all day, receiving only one meal, and his psychological assessment stating he seems 'psychologically stable'.

events.title: Draft Statement on Staff Reassignments
events.description: An email discusses a draft statement about the Attorney General directing the BOP to temporarily reassign the MCC warden and place three staff members on administrative leave following Epstein's suicide.

events.title: Psychological Reconstruction Document Sent
events.description: Lee Plourde sends an email with an attachment titled 'Psych Reconst - Epstein #76318-054.docx' to multiple BOP staff for their records.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered a non-prosecution agreement and pleaded guilty to one count of Solicitation of Prostitution and one count of Procuring a Person Under the Age of 18 for Prostitution in Florida.

events.title: First Suicide Watch Incident
events.description: Epstein was found in his cell with a piece of orange cloth around his neck, showing friction marks. He was placed on suicide watch. He initially claimed his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, attempted to kill him.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, an apparent suicide.

events.title: Drafting of staff placement on leave
events.description: Internal BOP email discusses drafting language to announce placing two (or three) MCC NY staff on administrative leave pending investigation into Epstein's death, and potentially reassigning the warden.

events.title: UK follow-up requests submitted
events.description: An attorney sends a detailed list of 13 questions to the BOP regarding MCC conditions, staffing, and the circumstances of Epstein's death, for use in Jabir Motiwala's extradition case.

events.title: BOP provides initial response to UK inquiries
events.description: A BOP Supervisory Staff Attorney provides a partial response regarding Warden J.'s background and psychology protocols at MCC, with more information to follow.

events.title: Apparent suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: BOP places staff on administrative leave
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons planned to place two staff members who worked in the Special Housing Unit at MCC NY on administrative leave pending the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: US Attorney interviews MCC NY Warden
events.description: The US Attorney was scheduled to meet with the MCC NY Warden on the morning of August 12, 2019, as part of the investigation.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Apparent Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: BOP Places Staff on Administrative Leave
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons placed two (potentially three) staff members from MCC NY's Special Housing Unit on administrative leave pending the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Warden Temporarily Reassigned
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons temporarily reassigned the MCC NY Warden to the Northeast Regional Office. The FCI Otisville Warden was named Acting Warden.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Psychological Observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein Arrives at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York (MCC) on a Saturday. He was initially placed in the Receiving and Discharge area and moved to general population, as staff were reportedly unaware he was a high-profile inmate.

events.title: Epstein Moved to SHU
events.description: The Warden identified Epstein as high-profile and moved him to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) due to concerns for his personal safety in general population.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Psychology Observation
events.description: After returning from court, Epstein was moved to Psychology Observation for evaluation. The notes specify this was NOT suicide watch, but he was under 24-hour observation to assess readiness for SHU.

events.title: Epstein Returned to SHU with Cellmate
events.description: Epstein was returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cellmate, identified as Nicholas Tartaglione. He remained there until July 23, 2019.

events.title: Reconstruction Report Drafted
events.description: A draft document titled 'Epstein Reconstruction 76318-054 draft9.docx' is emailed, indicating a formal review or investigation into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered a non-prosecution agreement and pleaded guilty to one count of Solicitation of Prostitution and one count of Procuring a Person Under the Age of 18 for Prostitution in Florida.

events.title: Arrest at Teterboro Airport
events.description: Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey upon his return from Paris, France, and transported to MCC New York.

events.title: Bail Denial
events.description: Judge M. Berman denied Epstein's request for bail and pretrial release, remanding him to custody as a danger and flight risk.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: Epstein's First Alleged Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein allegedly attempted suicide in his cell at MCC. Video footage from this incident was reportedly corrupted or missing.

events.title: BOP Staff Reassignments
events.description: The Attorney General directed the BOP to assign the MCC warden to a regional office and placed three MCC staff from Epstein's unit on administrative leave pending investigations.

events.title: Court Hearing on Missing Video
events.description: A court hearing addressed the missing video footage from outside Epstein's cell during his first alleged suicide attempt on July 23. The FBI reported the DVR footage was corrupted.

events.title: Court Testimony on MCC Conditions
events.description: The former warden (Ms. [Redacted]) provided court testimony regarding the poor conditions at the MCC, which is referenced in her later report.

events.title: Report on MCC Conditions
events.description: A report dated 22 August 2019, authored by former warden Ms. [Redacted], details severe deficiencies in staffing, sanitation, and inmate monitoring at the MCC.

events.title: BBC News Article on MCC
events.description: A BBC News article titled "Jeffrey Epstein jail 'a gulag' in lower Manhattan" is cited, highlighting inadequate psychiatric care and overall poor conditions at the MCC.

events.title: UK Response Deadline
events.description: The deadline for a response to the UK's follow-up questions regarding the Epstein case and MCC conditions.

events.title: Epstein Found Unconscious in Cell
events.description: Epstein was found unconscious in his jail cell with injuries to his neck; placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from suicide watch and returned to the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.

events.title: Documents Unsealed in Defamation Case
events.description: Thousands of documents were unsealed in a defamation case, revealing names of high-profile individuals connected to Epstein and allegations of impropriety.

events.title: Barr Press Conference and Staff Reassignments
events.description: AG Barr held a press conference expressing outrage; the warden was reassigned and two MCC employees placed on administrative leave.

events.title: New BOP Leadership Appointed
events.description: AG Barr appointed a new Director and Deputy Director to the Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in a suspected suicide.

events.title: El Chapo Sentencing
events.description: Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman sentenced and described his detention at MCC as 'psychological and mental torture 24 hours a day'.

events.title: Government Shutdown Hunger Strike
events.description: Inmates at MCC staged a hunger strike during a government shutdown over claims of denied family visitation rights.

events.title: Death of Whitey Bulger
events.description: Boston gangster Whitey Bulger was fatally beaten by another inmate shortly after arriving at a West Virginia federal prison.

events.title: Lauri Love Extradition Ruling
events.description: A British court ruled against extraditing accused hacker Lauri Love to the US, citing high suicide risk if held at MCC.

events.title: Barr Lifts Hiring Freeze
events.description: Attorney General William Barr lifted a hiring freeze at the Bureau of Prisons and ordered accelerated hiring.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide (as indicated by context) in his cell at the MCC's Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Former Warden's Report Filed
events.description: A report by a former MCC warden, detailing alleged poor conditions and procedural failures at the MCC, was filed by Jabir Motiwala's legal team.

events.title: UK Extradition Inquiry Email
events.description: AUSA Jonathan Rebold emails BOP contacts with a list of detailed questions from UK attorneys regarding MCC conditions following Epstein's death.

events.title: BOP Internal Coordination
events.description: BOP staff internally coordinate to gather information (warden bio, psychology measures, staffing data, etc.) to draft a response to the UK inquiry.

events.title: UK Follow-up Request Received
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office received follow-up questions from UK attorneys handling the Motiwala extradition, specifically citing Epstein's death and the former warden's report.

events.title: BOP Internal Information Gathering
events.description: BOP staff circulate an email requesting specific information (warden bio, staffing, procedures) to formulate a response to the UK's inquiries, while noting they cannot comment on the ongoing Epstein investigation.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death in MCC custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in an apparent suicide.

events.title: Court testimony on MCC conditions
events.description: A former warden of the MCC provided court testimony regarding conditions at the facility, which is referenced in the UK's questions.

events.title: Report on MCC conditions filed
events.description: A report dated August 22, 2019, by a former warden detailing alleged deficiencies at the MCC was filed in Jabir Motiwala's extradition case.

events.title: Deadline for US response to UK
events.description: The deadline for the U.S. authorities to respond to the UK's follow-up questions regarding extradition and MCC conditions.

events.title: Epstein's Psych Ops Discontinued / Attorney Visit
events.description: An email states that psychological operations (Psych Ops) for Jeffrey Epstein were discontinued at 8:15 AM. A separate note indicates he was released (likely from observation) and had an attorney visit starting at 8:20 AM that lasted all day.

events.title: Epstein's Psychological Observation Update
events.description: Internal email chain discusses inmate Epstein's psychological status. He is reported as 'psychologically stable' but complains of a numb arm and neck, and a noisy toilet that ran for 45 minutes. He is noted to be in Attorney Conference from 8 AM to 8 PM daily.

events.title: Email Forward Regarding Epstein's Status
events.description: An email is forwarded containing information about Epstein's registration number and the discontinuation of Psych Ops, along with attached files including a contact card for Associate Warden Charisma Edge.

events.title: Death of BOP Officer Andrew Douglas
events.description: Federal Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist Andrew 'Doug' Douglas died in the line of duty after suffering a medical event.

events.title: Suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The event is referenced in later complaints and incidents.

events.title: Attempted Suicide of Inmate Nevin Jones
events.description: Inmate Nevin Jones attempted suicide in his cell at FDC Philadelphia by using nooses anchored to his locker and bed frame. He was discovered and untied by Officer Raymond Colon. His suicide note referenced Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Complaint About Medical Neglect at MCC NY
events.description: Rabbi Shmuel Spritzer emailed BOP officials describing a medical emergency involving inmate Michael Elansky, alleging severe neglect and referencing the facility where Epstein died.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The document references this event as causing ongoing operational, staffing, and media scrutiny issues for the BOP.

events.title: Medical Emergency Complaint for Inmate Michael Elansky
events.description: Rabbi Shmuel Spritzer emails BOP Regional Director R. Ormond about inmate Michael Elansky's severe medical condition (migraines, vomiting, diarrhea, tremors) and alleged neglect at MCC New York, referencing the Epstein suicide.

events.title: Dissemination of News Clips on Inmate Suicides and Epstein
events.description: BOP employee Susan Allison sends an email with 'Noteworthy News Clips' including articles about increasing inmate suicides (mentioning Epstein), R. Kelly, calls for expanded Epstein investigation, and criminal justice reform.

events.title: Media Inquiry from NY Daily News on MCC NY Conditions
events.description: BOP Public Information Office handles a media inquiry from the NY Daily News about morale, staffing, and changes at MCC New York following Epstein's suicide and related staff charges.

events.title: Internal BOP Discussion on TDY Costs for Epstein Incident
events.description: Internal BOP emails discuss Temporary Duty (TDY) costs (~$500,000) for staff sent to MCC New York to implement new procedures after Epstein's death, revealing budget constraints and justifications.

events.title: Government's Letter to the Court
events.description: Referenced by Bruce Barket as the catalyst for needing a meeting to discuss conditions for Tartaglione withdrawing his request to be moved from MCC.

events.title: Attorney Visit with Tartaglione
events.description: Bruce Barket requests and is granted a visit with his client Nicholas Tartaglione at MCC at 5:00 PM.

events.title: BOP Offers Social Phone Call
events.description: MCC administrators, via Stephanie Scannell, offer Tartaglione a social phone call with his parents instead of an in-person visit, which Barket contests.

events.title: Epstein Visit Request Negotiations
events.description: Bruce Barket negotiates with MCC staff for social visits and phone calls for Jeffrey Epstein with his parents, citing preparation needs for a capital case.

events.title: Media Inquiry About MCC Conditions
events.description: NY Daily News reporter Stephen inquires about morale, staffing, and conditions at MCC New York following Epstein's suicide and falsification of documents charges against staff.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's suicide at MCC New York is referenced as the catalyst for media inquiries and policy reviews.

events.title: Epstein's Alleged First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein allegedly attempted suicide in his cell, which he shared with inmate Tartaglione. Video footage from outside the cell was reportedly preserved but later said to be corrupted/missing.

events.title: Court Hearing on Missing Epstein Video
events.description: A court hearing was held regarding the missing video footage from Epstein's alleged July 23 suicide attempt. The USAO advised the court that MCC did not preserve the video, contradicting earlier BOP advice.

events.title: BOP News Digest on Epstein Blame Game
events.description: Internal BOP news digest includes an article about the 'Jeffrey Epstein blame game,' referencing indictments of correctional officers for falsifying records and testimony by BOP Director Kathleen Hawk Sawyer.

events.title: BuzzFeed Inquiry on 4chan Leak
events.description: BuzzFeed News reporter Jane Lytvynenko contacts the BOP seeking verification of 4chan posts that described Epstein's death in detail before it was publicly announced, suggesting a possible leak by a first responder.

events.title: Washington Post Inquiry on Epstein Incident
events.description: Washington Post reporter Devlin Barrett contacts BOP, stating he was told inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious and unresponsive in his jail cell and that there is an internal inquiry.

events.title: US Marshals Service Seeks Information on Epstein
events.description: USMS employee Heather Lowry contacts BOP official Allen Beard, stating there has been an incident with high-profile prisoner Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York and that USMS is having a hard time getting any information from the facility.

events.title: Epstein on Psych Observation List
events.description: A BOP forensic psychologist sends a 'Suicide Watch/Psych Observation Update' listing Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) under 'Psych Observation' and 'Pending Bedspace for SHU'.

events.title: England Raises Extradition Concerns Post-Epstein
events.description: An email indicates England will not approve extradition of an inmate if he cannot be housed at MDC Brooklyn, as they do not want him housed at MCC New York 'based on what happened with Epstein'.

events.title: Morning Suicide Watch Update
events.description: A forensic psychologist at MCC New York sends an email update stating Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) is on suicide watch and there are no inmates on psych observation.

events.title: Afternoon Suicide Watch Update
events.description: A forensic psychologist at MCC New York sends an email update stating there are no inmates on suicide watch, but Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) is on psych observation.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Scheduled PI Visit to Epstein at MCC
events.description: Planned visit by private investigator Mr. O'Brien to Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, authorized under the Criminal Justice Act.

events.title: Internal BOP Email on MCC Chicago Staffing
events.description: Internal BOP email expresses concern about staffing issues and safety at MCC Chicago, referencing 'another Epstein episode' following Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Request for Epstein's Medical Records
events.description: An internal BOP email requests Jeffrey Epstein's updated medical records from July 2, 2019, to the present.

events.title: Provision of Epstein's Autopsy Case Number
events.description: Jeetendra Sodhi emails the autopsy case number (M19019432) for Jeffrey Epstein to a BOP email address.

events.title: Google Alert on Bureau of Prisons News
events.description: A Google Alert email is sent summarizing news articles about the Bureau of Prisons, including coverage of Epstein's suicide and its aftermath.

events.title: Request for Epstein Autopsy Information
events.description: BOP staff exchange emails attempting to obtain the case number for Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy and a draft letter to request the autopsy report itself.

events.title: Apparent Suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Referenced as the event that triggered the FBI and OIG investigations and subsequent administrative actions described in the emails.

events.title: Draft Statement on Administrative Actions
events.description: A draft statement is circulated indicating the Attorney General directed the temporary reassignment of the MCC warden and the placement of three MCC staff on administrative leave pending investigations into Epstein's death.

events.title: Dissemination of Updated Suicide Watch Procedures
events.description: Associate Warden Charisma Edge emails detailed new protocols for suicide watch cell assignments and notifications at MCC New York, developed in response to the Epstein incident.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's apparent suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: BOP administrative actions following Epstein's death
events.description: The Attorney General directed the BOP to temporarily assign the MCC warden to the Northeast Regional Office and placed three MCC correctional personnel on administrative leave.

events.title: Epstein's reported attempted suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein reportedly attempted suicide, leading to an interview of inmate Nicholas Tartaglione by BOP members.

events.title: Google Alert on Bureau of Prisons
events.description: Google Alert email sent to Charisma Edge containing news articles about the Bureau of Prisons, including mentions of R. Kelly and Epstein.

events.title: Google Alert on Bureau of Prisons
events.description: Google Alert email sent to Charisma Edge containing news articles about the Bureau of Prisons, including mentions of Epstein death conspiracy theories.

events.title: Epstein's reported suicide attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's reported attempted suicide attempt at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: Records request regarding Tartaglione statements
events.description: Attorney Bruce Barket sends email request to BOP officials for records of statements made by Nicholas Tartaglione about Epstein's suicide attempt.

events.title: BOP discusses staff placement on leave
events.description: Internal BOP email discussion about placing MCC NY staff on administrative leave pending investigation into Epstein's suicide, including potential reassignment of the warden.

events.title: News report on Epstein's prison mural
events.description: Business Insider reports that Jeffrey Epstein reportedly commissioned a mural of himself in a prison scene at his New York mansion.

events.title: Release of Heman Guerra Jr.
events.description: The U.S. Bureau of Prisons released former Sullivan City police chief Heman Guerra Jr. from a federal prison camp in Montgomery, Alabama.

events.title: Sentencing of Dr. Michael Lee Cummings
events.description: Dr. Michael Lee Cummings was sentenced to 30 months in prison for illegally prescribing opioids.

events.title: Altamira prison riot
events.description: A riot at the Altamira prison in Par, Brazil, leaves at least 57 inmates dead, with 16 decapitated, as part of drug turf disputes.

events.title: Altamira Prison Riot in Brazil
events.description: A prison riot in Altamira, Para, Brazil, leaves at least 57 prisoners dead, with 16 decapitated, during clashes between organized crime groups.

events.title: Email Forward Regarding Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: An email with the subject 'Epstein, Jeffrey Edward, Reg. No. 73618-054' and an attached document is sent to BOP Regional Director Ormond.

events.title: Google Alert on Epstein's Jail Conditions
events.description: A Google Alert reports that Jeffrey Epstein used his wealth to avoid his prison cell and empty out vending machines while in jail.

events.title: Medical Emergency Complaint for Michael Elansky
events.description: Rabbi Shmuel Spritzer emails BOP officials detailing a medical emergency for inmate Michael Elansky at MCC New York, alleging severe neglect and referencing Epstein's death at the same facility.

events.title: Bernie Sanders Unveils Criminal Justice Plan
events.description: Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders proposes a criminal justice overhaul aiming to cut the nation's prison population.

events.title: Epstein's Final Full Day
events.description: Epstein met with attorneys throughout the day. His cellmate, Reyes Efrain, departed for court and did not return. In the evening, Epstein was reported in 'good spirits' during a social call.

events.title: Suicide Watch Log Error Discovered
events.description: Charisma Edge emails colleagues to report that the wrong logbook (Inmate Companions Log) was used for Epstein's suicide watch instead of the proper Staff Suicide Watch log. A corrected log was created.

events.title: Internal Review and Response Preparation
events.description: Internal BOP emails show the drafting and review of an 'Epstein Response' document. A Supervisory Staff Attorney requests clarification on sections alleging improper staff conduct and the pulling of attorney logbooks.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrives at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York and is observed as 'distraught, sad and a little confused' by staff during the evening count.

events.title: Epstein placed in SHU with Tartaglione
events.description: Executive Staff decide to house Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with inmate Mr. Tartaglione as his cellmate.

events.title: First possible suicide attempt/gesture
events.description: Epstein found unresponsive in his cell with abrasions on his neck and knee. Inconsistent reports describe a string or orange cloth around his neck. He is placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Extended attorney visits during observation
events.description: While on Psychological Observation, Epstein attends attorney visits for extended hours (8-11.25 hours per day) without the required continuous direct observation by BOP staff.

events.title: Monitored call to Karina Shaliak
events.description: Unit Manager Proto provides Epstein with a monitored telephone call on a speaker phone to friend Karina Shaliak.

events.title: Court appearance and USMS alert
events.description: Epstein returns from court with a US Marshals Service Prisoner Custody Alert Notice indicating 'MTL Mental Concerns Suicidal Tendencies.'

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein dies in his cell. The memorandum is a response to the subsequent psychological reconstruction of his death.

events.title: Psychological Report Distribution
events.description: Lee Plourde emails a psychological reconstruction report for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (BOP #76318-054) to several BOP staff members.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death in MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, an apparent suicide.

events.title: Report on MCC Conditions Filed
events.description: A report by a former warden regarding conditions at MCC was filed in connection with Jabir Motiwala's extradition case.

events.title: Initial UK Inquiry Email
events.description: An email was sent (referenced in this chain) with follow-up requests from the UK regarding extradition and MCC conditions.

events.title: Rebold's Response Email
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Jonathan Rebold sends an email responding to and forwarding the UK's detailed questions about MCC protocols and Epstein's death.

events.title: Initial UK Inquiry Sent
events.description: Jonathan Rebold sent the initial request for information to the BOP, forwarding questions from UK attorneys about MCC conditions post-Epstein.

events.title: BOP Preliminary Response
events.description: A BOP Supervisory Staff Attorney provided a preliminary response detailing the new warden's background and standard psychology protocols in the SHU.

events.title: Email Correspondence on UK Inquiries
events.description: Email chain between U.S. Attorney Jonathan Rebold and BOP attorney Stephanie Scannell discussing detailed follow-up questions from UK authorities regarding MCC conditions post-Epstein.

events.title: UK Inquiry Email Sent
events.description: An initial email was sent from a U.S. attorney to BOP officials with detailed questions from the UK about MCC conditions post-Epstein.

events.title: Report on Epstein's death and MCC conditions
events.description: A report dated August 22, 2019, cited by the UK, details allegations about the failure to monitor Epstein, falsification of records, and systemic issues at the MCC.

events.title: CNN report on prison staffing shortages
events.description: A CNN article highlighted 'dire' federal prison staffing shortages and the use of 'augmentation' to assign non-correctional officers to guard posts.

events.title: News article 'Jeffrey Epstein jail "a gulag"'
events.description: A news article characterized the MCC as a 'gulag,' citing inadequate psychiatric care and consultations conducted through cell door slots.

events.title: DOJ/BOP Correspondence on UK Inquiry
events.description: Email chain between DOJ attorney Jonathan Rebold and BOP officials discussing and responding to detailed questions from UK attorneys about MCC conditions post-Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Epstein removed from suicide watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC.

events.title: UK follow-up inquiry on extradition
events.description: The UK followed up with U.S. DOJ attorneys requesting information on sanitation, pest control, and other MCC conditions related to the Jabir Motiwala extradition case.

events.title: Initial UK extradition information request
events.description: A U.S. Attorney sent a detailed request to BOP staff for information on MCC conditions, staffing, and Epstein's death to respond to UK extradition concerns.

events.title: Inmate Lopez Removed from Psych Observation
events.description: BOP staff note that inmate Lopez (#20472-038) is being taken off of psychological observation.

events.title: Distribution of Psych Reconstruction Report
events.description: Lee Plourde distributes a psychological reconstruction report for Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) to a list of BOP executive staff and other personnel.

events.title: Email with Epstein document created
events.description: An email with an attachment titled 'Psych Reconst - Epstein #76318-054.docx' was created in the email system.

events.title: Email tagged as responsive
events.description: The email containing the Epstein-related document was tagged as 'Responsive' in the system, likely in relation to a legal or investigative process.

events.title: Psychological Reassessment Scheduled for Epstein
events.description: A psychological reassessment for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (BOP #76318-054) was scheduled for 09:18:35 on this date, as indicated in an email from BOP staff.

events.title: Google Alert on Bureau of Prisons
events.description: A Google Alert email containing news headlines about the Bureau of Prisons, including references to Jeffrey Epstein's death, is sent to a BOP email address.

events.title: Google Alert on prison
events.description: A Google Alert email containing news headlines about prisons, including a report about an MCC guard willing to cooperate with the Epstein death investigation, is sent to a BOP email address.

events.title: Google Alert on Bureau of Prisons
events.description: A Google Alert email containing news headlines about the Bureau of Prisons, including a call to finish the Epstein death investigation, is sent to a BOP email address.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Multiple news alerts reference Epstein's death in a federal jail, highlighting long-standing problems at the Manhattan jail and throughout the Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Epstein moved to Special Housing Unit (SHU)
events.description: The Warden identified Epstein as high-profile and moved him to the Special Housing Unit due to concerns for his personal safety in general population.

events.title: Epstein placed in Psychology Observation
events.description: Upon return of Psychology Service staff on Monday, Epstein was moved to Psychology Observation for evaluation. Notes indicated suicide watch was not warranted, but he was under 24-hour observation.

events.title: Epstein returned to SHU with cell mate
events.description: After evaluation, Epstein was returned to the Special Housing Unit with a cell mate, where he remained until July 23.

events.title: Florida request for Epstein death documentation

events.title: Defense meeting scheduled at MCC
events.description: Defense attorney Bruce Barket corresponded with BOP staff attorney Stephanie Scannell to schedule a meeting with his client, inmate Nick Tartaglione, at MCC. The meeting faced delays due to a special security count.

events.title: Epstein Death Incident
events.description: Implied reference to the DVR being pulled for the '8/10 incident,' which is the date of Jeffrey Epstein's death by suicide in his MCC cell.

events.title: Scheduled Attorney-Client Meeting
events.description: Bruce Barket schedules a meeting with his client Nicholas Tartaglione at 5:00 PM at MCC, though delayed due to a special security count.

events.title: Request for Parental Visit

events.description: A court hearing was held where the USAO advised the court that MCC did not preserve video from outside Epstein and Tartaglione's cell from July 23, contradicting earlier SIS advice.

events.title: BOP Administrative Actions
events.description: The Attorney General directed the BOP to temporarily assign the MCC warden to a regional office and place two MCC staff from Epstein's unit on administrative leave pending investigations.

events.title: Missing Video Investigation Update
events.description: Email correspondence reveals that video footage from outside Epstein's cell from the July 23 attempt is missing. The FBI reported the DVR footage was corrupted, and AUSAs are asking BOP to search for preserved copies.

events.title: Scheduling of Tartaglione Legal Discussions
events.description: Series of emails between defense attorney Bruce Barket, AUSA Jason Swergold, and MCC staff to schedule a meeting to discuss the conditions under which inmate Nicholas Tartaglione would withdraw his request to be moved from MCC.

events.title: Arrangement of Tartaglione Visits

events.title: Attorney Access Issue

events.title: Google Alert on Federal Prisoners

events.title: Epstein Death Investigation Staff Actions
events.description: Internal BOP discussion about placing two staff from MCC NY's Special Housing Unit on administrative leave, and potentially reassigning the warden, pending investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Court Order in USA v. Epstein
events.description: A court order in the case USA v. Jeffrey Epstein (19 cr 490) is sent from the court to the BOP and forwarded internally.

keyFacts: A psychological reconstruction document was created for Jeffrey Epstein under his federal inmate number #76318-054.
The document was emailed within the Bureau of Prisons system on October 4, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death in August 2019.
The email and attachment were later archived and tagged in the BOP system in May 2020, indicating post-mortem review or record-keeping.
The document's existence suggests ongoing administrative or investigative processes regarding Epstein following his death.
The report concludes Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, was a suicide, citing factors like loss of status, lack of deep interpersonal ties, and facing a potential 45-year sentence.

Critical failures are documented: Epstein was single-celled the night he died despite policy; 30-minute rounds were not completed; SENTRY inmate housing assignments were inaccurate; and key log books were not secured as evidence.
On July 23, 2019, Epstein was found with a cloth around his neck but denied a suicide attempt, blaming cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. An investigation was inconclusive.
On August 9, 2019, the day before his death, Epstein made a phone call, telling Unit Manager Nathaniel Bullock he was calling his mother, who had been deceased since 2004.

The reconstruction was severely limited because the FBI had confiscated the original video of the incident, and formal interviews were not conducted to avoid interfering with other DOJ investigations.
Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
A BOP internal timeline details Epstein's arrival and housing from July 6-23, 2019, including moves from general population to SHU to Psychological Observation and back to SHU.
Attorney General William Barr characterized Epstein's jailhouse suicide as 'a perfect storm of screw-ups.'
Media inquiries following Epstein's death focused on the circumstances of his death, suicide watch status, and reassignments of BOP staff at MCC.
Defense attorneys from Epstein Sacks PLLC were corresponding with the BOP in December 2019 to arrange for a private investigator to visit a client at MCC.
A psychologist at the MCC New York approved Jeffrey Epstein's removal from suicide watch before he killed himself, as disclosed in a DOJ letter from Assistant Attorney General Stephen Boyd.
